titleStmt.title: 1801 - 1838 Merchant and Shipping Account Log Book from Black Rock, Fairfield, Connecticut
titleStmt.author: Thomas Bartram

respStmt.resp: XML mentorship, encoding, proof-reading, and processing provided by
Project management and XML encoding by

editionStmt.edition: First digital edition in TEI, date: 1 December 2016. P5.

availability.p: Reproduced by courtesy of the Connecticut Historical Society.
availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License

msIdentifier.repository: Connecticut Historical Society in Hartford, CT

handNotes.handNote: Black ink. Probably a different hand from Bartram's drawing an X on pages .

editorialDecl.p: Bartram's spelling and punctuation are retained, except where a word is split at the end of a line and the beginning of the next in the manuscript. Where Bartram's spelling and hyphenation of words deviates from the standard, in order to facilitate searching we are using the TEI elements "choice," "sic," and "reg" to encode both Bartram's spelling and the regular international standard of Oxford English spelling, following the first listed spelling in the Oxford English Dictionary.

char.charName: LATIN UPPER T AND LATIN LOWER O
char.desc: Seen frequently at the start of a list item (looks similar to a cursive "To" or "%" symbol).
Seen frequently at the end of a list item (series of hyphens) used in manuscript to indicate connection between list item and price/cost.

char.charName: LATIN UPPER D AND LATIN LOWER O

char.desc: Frequently comes after name of person log entry is under.

list.item: Bartram, Thomas Acct. book. Fairfield County. 1801-1819
Book Bought of Seth Perry December 24 1801

Joiners Bill Fraiming Framing
& Covering Barn 9 18 0
Bought of Daniel Gregory 8 Thousand Brick at 5 Dollars Thousand & paid him Forty Dollars February 10 1802 12 0 0
harth hearth Stones & and Mason Bill 2 10 0
Nailes Nails for floor & inside work 3 0 0
Clear Cleer Boards of Short Shingles
By hiring Cart with my help
By Shewing one yoak oxen by iron & help
By Seting Setting ox Shews my help

unclear.supplied: By Making bellows pipe and Band 0 8 3

list.item: gave Seth Perry 1907 to go to N york to by buy cargo
Stock belonging to sloop Fame Nov 12 1809
Two drafts Drawn by John wait briant boston for 1840
For $1840 freight to Newy New York 18.40
Cash paid will Hayt for paints to paint house $94 75
Cash paid to Elijah Turney for work painting House 6 00
Cash paid to Squire Nichols for white Lead 83
Due on Due bill when Settled April 6, 1802 2 1 9
Strap & Ring and ring my iron on the apple tree 0 2 0
Shewing horse all round Steel Toes & New Shews my Steel 0 0 6
put tine tin iron on Cart 0 3 0
Shewing one yoak oxen 4 shews new
Mend Staple & new tree my iron 0 3 0
this account is passed further over
By veal 1/4 to horse to Newfield
By 3 Cattle team to Ozias Burr Sawmill Drove Them my self 0 3 9
one pair Boot Legs for women 0 5 6
by one Saddle & Bridle my Sturrups> 3 6 0
by one half day make cart 0 4 0
This Day Settled all accounts to this Date Onifimius hubbell

10 3/4 of Flax at 1/ Per Pou Pound
0 10

freight on appletrees Paid Capt Thorp 0 15
2 Shews New St Toes & Corks my Steel 3 06
fix needle rings bolt for Slay 0 1
2 irons To hand flax Mill on
New hook & Links Charge my iron 0 2
by one Hundred Apple trees at 1/ 4 17 6
By oxen & Cart in woods one Day

By horse to B port Bridgeport
0 1

Four Thousdand Five Hundred 3 feet Shingles at 24 6 0

pirt port

one third of paster pasture Lot one Sommer Summer
